div.h3: OBMS Student Council Collected Over 500 toys to Donate to Lebonheur

div.a: Hernando’s Starnes named Parent of the Year

br.p: A Hernando mother who has been active as a booster for her child’s school and its athletic programs has been named the DeSoto County Schools’ Parent of the Year.
Public schools in DeSoto County will continue to be shuttered through April 17, as directed by Mississippi Gov. Tate Reeves.

img.alt: Olive Branch High School Girls Basketball

br.p: The win was Olive Branch’s second straight state championship, with the 6A victory following last year’s 5A crown.

img.alt: Lisa Steiner, Lake Comorant Middle School

br.p: Lisa Steiner, principal at Lake Cormorant Middle School, has been named as the district’s Administrator of the Year.

For the third straight year, the DeSoto Central High School cheerleading team returns from Orlando, Florida and the United Cheerleading Association (UCA) National High School Cheerleading Championship as national champions

p.span: DCS is committed to providing a work environment that is free of discrimination. It is the policy of DCS that all applicants and employees are entitled to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion or creed, gender (includes pregnancy or related medical conditions), national origin, age, disability, veteran status or other protected characteristics as required by local, state and federal law.

The DeSoto County School District is also committed to providing a website that is accessible to the widest possible audience, regardless of technology or ability. This website endeavors to comply with best practices and standards defined by Section 508 of the U.S. Rehabilitation Act. If you would like additional assistance or have accessibility concerns, please contact the webmaster at (662) 449.7183. We are always striving to improve the accessibility standards of our website. For more information, please visit our Website Accessibility page.
